results.title: Ibrahim
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Material Production Curriculum Branch Education Dept of Victoria
results.brief_description: This film has been made to provoke discussion of issues about racial prejudice. It tells the story of Ibrahim, a twelve-year-old Lebanese boy, who comes to Melbourne from war-torn Beirut. He goes straight into a post-primary school knowing no English and haunted by the horrors he has seen. Cast includes Sherif Abada. Based on a story by Jane Watson. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Camberwell Junction
results.brief_description: Made by Ivan Gaal, this film is in three parts. Still photographs of ‘past…definite’ are accompanied by sounds of horses hooves. ‘Present…indicative’ shows speeded up traffic during the day and night, making it difficult for people to cross the roads. ‘Future…indefinite’ poses a question mark.

results.title: [Matthew Flinders: bi-centennial celebrations 1974]
results.creator_credit: Country Roads Board, Department of Agriculture and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Captures the various bi-centennial celebrations that were organised in Victoria to commemorate the birth of Captain Matthew Flinders. Includes footage of the Shrine; Mornington beach; Arthur’s Seat; Port Philip Bay; Station Peaks; Flinder’s Street Station; St Paul’s Cathedral; Swanston street; and the Matthew Flinders torch relay. Leading Victorian figures appear unveiling commemorative plaques. This is an un-edited film without a soundtrack which documents many of the celebrations.

results.title: Hennessy's holiday
results.brief_description: The visit to Melbourne of Hennessy, a 180-pound St. Bernard dog. He sees the Botanical Gardens, the Sidney Myer Music Bowl, and the Shrine, and takes a run around the M.C.G. After intensive grooming he wins a prize at the Royal Melbourne Show, the takes a ride on the “Mightie Mouse” [sic], and he also enjoys a ride on Puffing Billy and a spin on the bay in a speedboat. A modelling appointment, having his portrait drawn by a cartoonist, and an appearance on ‘In Melbourne Tonight’ help make his visit a memorable one for all.

results.title: The Marist way
results.brief_description: Locally produced documentary promoting the virtues of the monastic life, and teaching methods practise by the Marist Order. The film details the rigorous regime of scholastic, spiritual and athletic training the Brothers apply to their words in boarding schools across Australia. In conclusion, it asks which of their charges will assume their monastic vocation.

results.title: [Tony Agapitos: Miss Greek Charity Quest]
results.brief_description:
This silent film shows people at the Athenaeum Club in Melbourne celebrating the New Year and finalists of the Miss Greek Charity Quest.

This film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.

results.title: [Tony Agapitos: Preparations for Miss Greek Charity Quest]
results.brief_description:
This film shows a small fundraiser and social occasion with Greek youth holding a raffle, barbecue and dance. Money raised supported the Miss Greek Charity Quest, for which the preparations can be seen.

This film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.

results.title: [Tony Agapitos: Ninolakis the Poet]
results.brief_description:
This silent film shows an intimate lounge room party and poetry reading by a poet known as Ninolakis.

This film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.

results.title: [Tony Agapitos: 3ZZ Protest March]
results.brief_description:
‘Protest March, Melbourne’ (circa 1975-77) shows a protest march in Melbourne in the mid-1970s in support of multi-lingual community radio station 3ZZ, with crowds gathering at City Square then marching up Swanston Street.

This film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.

results.title: [Tony Agapitos: Greek Boy Scouts and Girl Guides supporting Bishop at Festival Hall]
results.brief_description:
This silent film shows the Greek Boy Scouts and other children assembling to celebrate National Day of the Greek Community, 25th March 1966 at Festival Hall, Melbourne.

This film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.
